definition: to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello
many/much/often/a lot of/numerous/more/in excess/how (to what extent)/multi-/Taiwan pr. [duo2] when it means "how"

sentences.english: There aring a lot of secrets in the man heart can't say literally that let wife listen to.
sentences.chinese: 男人心中有好多秘密不能随便说给妻子听。

sentences.english: I want to have many money.
Her stomach trouble is much better than before.
sentences.chinese: 她的胃病比先前好多了。

sentences.english: 0ne place where you find lots of backseat drivers is in politics.
sentences.chinese: 要说指手画脚的人，在政界你可以找到好多。

sentences.english: This song have got a lot of awards in hong kong.
sentences.chinese: 曾经攞过好多合唱歌曲奖既歌。

sentences.english: By the next day, Cindel was much better.
sentences.chinese: 第二天，辛德尔就好多了。

sentences.english: I shocked a lot of things heart, afraid other people look down on their own.
sentences.chinese: 好多东西让我怛心，好怕别人看不起自已。

sentences.english: She has thinned down a lot since last year.
sentences.chinese: 自去年以来她瘦了好多。

sentences.english: In China, many farmers grain the pigs.
sentences.chinese: 在中国，好多农民都是用谷物喂猪。

sentences.english: The patient is much better. She's got an appetite now.
sentences.chinese: 这个病人好多了，饭也吃得下了。

sentences.english: So many foreigners aspire to Chinese culture because of the prosperities in our country.
sentences.chinese: 我们国家欣欣向荣，好多外国人都十分向往中国文化。

sentences.english: There are so many adorable girl schnauzers here in the Lover Zone.
sentences.chinese: 在情人区有好多可爱的小雪妹妹。

sentences.english: I’ve watched and filmed him for years.
sentences.chinese: 我都观察拍摄它好多年了。

sentences.english: lots of different kinds of people, multicultural.
sentences.chinese: 好多不同的人，多种文化。

sentences.english: She pored her eyes out over his letters.
sentences.chinese: 她因看了他的好多封来信，把眼睛都看花了。

sentences.english: You can save a lot by paying cash.
sentences.chinese: 你付现金，你可以攒好多钱。

definition: some/a few/a little/(following an adjective) slightly ...er
a good deal of/quite a lot
to hear (sth said)/one hears (that)/hearsay/listening and speaking
